entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs national debt passes $13B: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs national debt passes $13B: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç The United States imposed a 10% tariff on all imports from Armenia, as President Donald Trump escalates his global trade war. Trade between the two countries amounted to $410 million last year, representing less than 1.5% of Armenia‚Äôs total trade. üìç Armenia‚Äôs national debt surpassed $13 billion, pushing the country‚Äôs debt-to-GDP ratio to more than 53%, according to the latest figures from the Finance Ministry. üìç Armenia collected about $1.4 billion in taxes in the first quarter of the year, marking a year-on-year increase of more than 13%, according to the State Revenue Committee. üìç The Radisson Hotel Group opened its first hotel in Gyumri, Armenia‚Äôs second city.

entry.title: Baku demands Armenia provide landmine maps

media:group.media:title: Baku demands Armenia provide landmine maps
media:group.media:description:
üìç Martun Grigoryan, a candidate in Gyumri‚Äôs mayoral election, announced that his Our City bloc will align with former mayor Vardan Ghukasyan, the Communist Party‚Äôs candidate, to form an opposition coalition against the ruling Civil Contract Party in the city council. üìç Azerbaijan is demanding accurate minefield maps from Armenia, arguing that the ones provided so far are unreliable.Aykhan Hajizada, spokesperson for Azerbaijan‚Äôs Foreign Ministry, claimed today that the maps Armenia has so far handed over are only 25% accurate. üìç International human rights lawyer Jared Genser, who represents businessman and former Karabakh cabinet leader Ruben Vardanyan, has called on the U.S. government to fulfill its commitment to protect Armenian Christians and mediate the release of Armenian prisoners from Azerbaijani captivity. üìç The Armenian government plans to subsidize airlines that introduce flights from new destinations to the country‚Äôs airports. The new bill introduces financial incentives for carriers operating previously unserved routes. üìç Mozrov: A Village Without Children https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6vN-IPPPhSg

media:group.media:title: Mozrov: A Village Without Children
media:group.media:description:
In the village of Mozrov in the Vayots Dzor Province, there are no children. There are also no stores, no schools, no hospitals, no paved roads, and no irrigation water. There is also a lack of hope that these things ever will be. In this mostly abandoned village, however, there are still people who have stories to tell.

media:group.media:title: Gyumri‚Äôs election circus explained
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian examines Armenia‚Äôs recent parliamentary motion supporting EU membership, considering its symbolic value, political realities, and the misleading narratives surrounding it. He also analyzes Sunday‚Äôs mayoral election in Gyumri, Armenia‚Äôs second-largest city, critiquing the dysfunction of local politics and the potential implications for next year‚Äôs national election.
